_header: And said lo Adam is one of us
Note:
Probably extracts of a longer work; see Pickering (1973)
XPickering, Oliver S. “The Temporale Narratives of the South English Legendary.” Anglia 91 (1973): 425-55, 433. For a prose version, derived from the same Latin original, see Horstmann (1878)
XHorstmann, Carl. Sammlung altenglischer Legenden. Heilbronn: Henninger, 1878, 103-18.
_description: The Life of Adam and Eve, two insertions in one manuscript of the Old Testament History (6345) — 528 lines in couplets

CamTCC605.First Lines:
And seyde lo adam ys on of ous to connyng wel & goudIch hote
                    þat ȝe honoury hym wit wel mylde mod…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Ihesu crist of heuene þat bore was of a mayde
                    ȝyngeȝyf ous oure saules helpe & goud endynge
CamTCC605.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.25.
